entries.name: Winged Form
entries: You have a flying speed equal to your movement speed.

entries.name: Malformed Wings
entries: You fall at the end of your turn if you are airborne and the only thing holding you aloft is your flying speed.

entries.name: Divine Magic
entries: Your exposure to the magic of Delamir has given you some innate spellcasting, connected to the elements. You know one cantrip from the {@filter Primal Spell list|spells|level=0|group=primal}. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace that spell with a different one from the Primal Spell list.
Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for any spell you cast with this trait (choose when you select this species).

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have Proficiency in the {@skill Perception} Skill.

entries.name: Tempestborn Resistance
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage and thunder damage.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Light Bearer
entries: You know the {@spell light} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip (choose when you select this species).

entries.name: Fulgur's Fury
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to unleash the divine lightning within yourself, causing arcs of lightning to emenate from you. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action.

During your transformation, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes lightning damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra lightning damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Aquatic Affinity
entries: Adapting effortlessly to water, you can hold your breath for up to 10 minutes and have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, you can see up to 30 feet in murky water as if it were clear.

entries.name: Au Naturel
entries: You are proficient in the {@skill nature} skill.

entries.name: Furious Claws
entries: Your retractable claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with such an attack, you inflict slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Immediately after dealing damage in this way you can make a second attack with them as a bonus action.

entries.name: Rolling Stone
entries: You are proficient with vehicles.

entries.name: Shake It Off
entries: When you make a saving throw to avoid the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition poisoned} or {@condition stunned} condition, you may use a reaction to give yourself advantage on the roll.

entries.name: Water Diviner
entries: You inherently know in which direction and how far away to find the nearest major bodies of water, even deep underground. Otterfolk can often be found in the greater world as hired dowsers

item.name: Xerc's Tin Foil Hat
entries: This tin foil hat is not actually magical in any way but if the wearer believes strongly enough that it is, it grants them advantage on saving throws to avoid being {@condition charmed|phb} or {@condition frightened|phb}.

item.name: Xerc's Medicinal Cheese
entries: This foul smelling cheese appears to be covered in cat hairs and can be used to restore vitality...somehow.
When a creature consumes this cheese as a bonus action, they can instantly expend and roll one Hit Die, they then regain hit points equal to the result of the roll + their Constitution modifier.

item.name: Xerc's Unicorn Totem
entries: This carved pale wood totem resembles a unicorn's head. While attuned to this item, you know the {@spell gust|xge} and {@spell magic stone|xge} cantrips and Wisdom is your spellcasting modifier for them.

When you cast the gust cantrip, the air erupts from your mouth and smells distictly of cheese. Similarly, the stones you imbue with the magic stone cantrip smell of cheese for the duration of the spell.

item.name: Xerc's WeeWoo Bardiche
entries: Wielded by the mighty orc chieftain Xerc, this polearm appears as brutal as it is deadly. It also goes "WeeWoo" very loudly when danger is near
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This magic weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, you have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, you and any of your companions within 30 feet of you can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, except when {@condition incapacitated} by something other than nonmagical sleep. The weapon magically awakens you and your companions within range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

item.name: +1 Tooth of Abyssos
entries: This long and thin tooth allegedly originates from an ancient and monstorous child of Typhon.
While holding this tooth, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the tooth. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +2 Tooth of Abyssos
entries: This long and thin tooth allegedly originates from an ancient and monstorous child of Typhon. Since its discovery, it has been enhanced by Teximus of Thalia and also by a chaotic being from the realms of Madness.
While holding this tooth, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the tooth. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

Finally, when you cast a warlock spell using this tooth, you can roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the Player's Handbook. If the result is a spell that normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration. If you roll a 99 or higher, you regain an expended warlock spell slot.

item.name: Broddah's Clockhand Maul
entries: This large bronze clockhand was found fused with stone in the volcano of Thalia. It's possible this was intended as a challenge for adventurers to free the hand from the stone. Unfotunately, the most recent adventurer to come across it, simply took the stone along with the hand.
This weapon uses the statistics of a {@item maul|phb}, but is otherwise considered an improvised weapon.

item.name: Broddah's Clockhand Longsword
entries: This large bronze clockhand was found in the volcano of Thalia.
This weapon uses the statistics of a {@item longsword|phb}, but is otherwise considered an improvised weapon.

item.name: Broddah's Clockhand Shortsword
entries: This narrow bronze clockhand was once wielded by an {@creature fire elemental myrmidon|mpmm} in the volcano of Thalia. It was very proud it.
This weapon uses the statistics of a {@item shortsword|phb}, but is otherwise considered an improvised weapon.

item.name: Watermelon of Healing
entries: This watermelon was grown using an infusion of various elixirs, protecting it from decay and granting restorative properties when consumed. It weighs {@dice 3d6+12} pounds when found. Some variants are magically flavored to taste like all manor of foodstuffs.

You can use an action to eat a number of pounds of the watermelon and regain {@dice 1d4+1} hit points for each pound consumed. If you attempt to consume 4 pounds or more in a single action, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + pounds consumed), or fail to regain any hit points and become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn as you begin vomiting profusely.

Additionally, If you consume 15 pounds or more in a single turn without failing the saving throw, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that saw you consume the melon for the next minute.

item.name: Broddah's Wooden Cup
entries: This simple looking wooden cup holds a fragment of legacy from those who love Broddah, his family, his friends and all those whom he has helped and brought joy to.

Whilst Broddah is alive, only he can attune to this item and it does not count against the number of items he has attuned to. If Broddah is dead, and a creature attempts to attune to this item, Broddah's soul can choose to allow or deny the attunement.
When you drink from this cup while attuned, invisible spirits of Broddah's loved ones lend their strength to yours. You gain the following benefits until you finish your next long rest:

items: When you take the {@action Grapple} or {@action Shove} action, you can target a creature of any size. If the target is more than two sizes larger than you, it has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to avoid or escape your grapple or shove.
Moving with a grappled creature that is your size or smaller no longer halves your movement speed.

item.name: Broddah's Adamantine Cup
entries: This elaborate but slightly melted adamantine cup holds a fragment of the connections and affection Broddah has fostered with divine beings, primarily Dionysus.

Whilst Broddah is alive, only he can attune to this item and it does not count against the number of items he has attuned to. If Broddah is dead, and a creature attempts to attune to this item, Broddah's soul can choose to allow or deny the attunement.

When you drink heavily from this cup while attuned, your mind briefly reaches a higher (or lower) state of being, allowing you to converse with a divine being in a similarly intoxicated state and that is familiar to Broddah, usually Dionysus. You can cast the {@spell commune|phb} spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast the spell using this item, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: The Morning Herald
entries: This modified brass and redwood giff training pistol was given to Bonnie O'Flynn by Horatio Kalthoff as he trained her to wield, repair and modify firearms. It is noticably heavier than a typical pistol and features two vertically stacked barrels, each with their own wheel and trigger. Firing this pistol is extremely loud, hence its name.

item.name: The Gift
entries: This ornate black and silver musket was given to Bonnie O'Flynn by a late friend. It has cleary seen much use, as well as many repairs and modifications throughout the years. It also features the name 'Amanda' crudely carved into the stock.

item.name: Mugbear
entries: This miraculous mug can be picked up from up to 10 feet away without needing to lean or move toward it.

item.name: Leomund's Tiny Cup
entries: This tiny cup holds about a thimble's worth of drink. The drink is always the perfect temperature and briefly fills you with a comforting warmth when you drink it.

item.name: Yeast Sense
entries: This thick, brothy beer tastes like bread. The first time you see a piece of bread after drinking this beer, you percieve the world as if you were the bread, seeing and hearing from its space. While doing so, you are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to your own surroundings. These effects last for 1 minute or until you take damage.

item.name: Cause Beer
entries: This golden ale allows you to share the sensations of inebriation. When you drink this ale, once before your next long rest, you can choose up to three creatures you can see within 30 feet. Each creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become inebriated and {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the effects on a success.

item.name: Potion of MADNESS
entries: This squirming liquid appears to change color and consistency constantly. You gain {@dice 2d10} temporary hitpoints when you drink this potion and trigger a {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB}.

item.name: MADNESS Tattoo
entries: Produced by even gods don't know what, this magic tattoo features a constantly shifting and squiggly spiral pattern that seems to change between various red and yellow hues randomly.

As an action You can cast the {@spell confusion|phb} spell (DC 15) one time without material components. The tattoo glows faintly while you cast the spell and for the spell's duration. Once the spell ends, the tattoo vanitheys from your skin.

item.name: +1 Poisoner's Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +1 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 5 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting poisons only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +1 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +2 Poisoner's Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +2 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 7 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting poisons only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +3 Poisoner's Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +3 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 9 charges, and regains {@dice 1d8+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting poisons only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +3 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +1 Herbalism Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +1 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 5 charges, and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting potions only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +1 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +2 Herbalism Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +2 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 7 charges, and regains {@dice 1d6+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting potions only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +2 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

item.name: +3 Herbalism Kit of the Witch
entries: You have a +3 bonus to ability checks made with this set of tools.

Additionally, this item has 9 charges, and regains {@dice 1d8+1} charges daily at dawn. If you are proficient with these tools, you can expend 2 or more charges to cast the {@spell enhance concoction|J:Witch} spell, targeting potions only. For 2 charges you cast the 2nd-level version of the spell, for each additional charge you expend, the spell's level increases by 1. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell, and you have a +3 bonus to your spell save DC for this casting, unless you already have a bonus to your spell save DC.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Bomber is a retainer, as described on page 9 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions.

trait.name: Dwarven Resiliance
entries: Bomber has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Follower of Tresmed
entries: Bomber acknowledges many gods, but primarily follows Tresmed, the Litinvr god of woodworking. Bomber has proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}.

action.name: Signature Attack (Longbow)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 plus PB} piercing damage.
Beginning at 7th level, bomber can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 5th Level: Special Shot (5/Day)
entries: Bomber makes a signature attack against all creatures in 20-foot cone or 30-foot line.

action.name: 7th Level: Arcane Arrowsmith (3/Day)
entries: Using woodcarver's tools, Bomber touches a nonmagical arrow and turn it into a {@filter random uncommon trick arrow|items|source=j:ammo|type=!modern;!futuristic|rarity=uncommon|category=|base item=arrow__phb}. The arrow remains magical until used, or until the next dawn. The arrow can be given to other creatures, they instinctively know the arrows will become mundane at the next dawn.

bonus.name: 3rd Level: Acrobatic Archer (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Bomber jumps up to 5xPB feet without provoking opportunity attacks. During this jump, Bomber can make a signature attack. If Bomber is above the target, this attack has advantage. On a hit, this attack deals PB extra damage.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Gomber is a retainer, as described on page 9 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions.

trait.name: Dwarven Resiliance
entries: Gomber has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Follower of Olga
entries: Gomber acknowledges many gods, but primarily follows Olga, the Litinvr god of feasting. Gomber has proficiency with brewer's supplies.

action.name: Signature Attack (Hop Vine Whip)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6} piercing damage and a Large or smaller target is pulled 10 feet towards Gomber.
Beginning at 7th level, Gomber deals an additional {@dice 1d6} with this attack.

action.name: 5th Level: Magic Drinks (3/Day)
entries: Gomber casts one of the following spells at 2nd-level; {@spell cure wounds|phb}, {@spell entangle|phb}, {@spell goodberry|phb} or {@spell lesser restoration|phb}.

Wisdom is their spellcasting ability, and these spells often take forms associated with drinking and feasting. For example, goodberry might appear as small drinks while entangle might appear as hop vines or spectral feasters.

action.name: 7th Level: WIP
entries: Gomber will figure out their shit one day.

bonus.name: 3rd Level: Skinchange (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action,  Gomber transforms into a more bestial form for the next hour, or until they are reduced to 0 hit points. Gomber chooses the appearance of their new form, however, their statistics do not change, except they can choose to become Small or Medium and they gain two of the following additional effects for the duration of the form:

items.name: Keen Senses
entries: Gomber gains advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

items.name: Natural Weapons
entries: Gomber's unarmed strikes use Wisdom in place of Strength for the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals 1d8 + PB bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage depending on the nature of the weapons.

Beginning at 7th level, Gomber can make two unarmed strikes when they take the Attack action while in skinchange form, and these attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

items.name: Hulking Frame
entries: Gomber becomes Large and has advantage on Strength checks. This effect cannot be chosen at the same time as Tiny Frame.

items.name: Scrambler
entries: Gomber gains a climbing speed equal to their walking speed and their jump distance is doubled.

items.name: Swimmer
entries: Gomber gains a swimming speed equal to their walking speed and they can breathe underwater.

items.name: Tiny Frame
entries: Gomber becomes Tiny and has advantage on Dexterity checks. This effect cannot be chosen at the same time as Hulking Frame.

items.name: Tough Hide
entries: Gomber gains temporary hit points equal to three times their level. They lose these temporary hit points when the skinchange ends.

hp.special: Eight times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to their level)

trait.name: Retainer
entries: Somber is a retainer, as described on page 9 of Flee Mortals! by MCDM Productions.

trait.name: Dwarven Resiliance
entries: Somber has advantage on saving throws against poison.

trait.name: Follower of Skjalver
entries: Somber acknowledges many gods, but primarily follows Skjalver, the Imiskr god of death. Somber also has proficiency with {@item body modder's tools|J:General}.

action.name: Signature Attack (Longshoreman's Hook)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d4 plus PB} piercing damage. Alternatively, on a hit, Somber can forgo damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against the attack roll or fall @{condition prone|phb}.
Beginning at 7th level, Somber can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Death Smite (3/Day)
entries: When Somber hits a creature with a signature attack, they can deal an additional PBd6 necrotic damage.

action.name: 5th Level: Fear of Death (3/Day)
entries: Somber chooses PB creatures that they can see within 30 feet. Each creature must make a DC 10 plus PB Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of somber for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). Somber has advantage on attack rolls against creatures frightened by them.

reaction.name: 7th Level: Bolstering Aura (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Somber can see within 30 feet makes a saving throw, Somber can use a reaction to grant them a PB bonus to the saving throw.

monster.name: Aisling (Young)
languages: knows the languages Thena does but does not speak

trait.name: Draconic Essence (Fire) & Secondary Essence (Radiant)
entries: Aisling is immune to fire damage. Their Breath Weapon and Destructive maw traits use fire damage.
Aisling is also immune to radiant damage. Whenever they use their Breath Weapon or Destructive Maw trait, they can choose to use radiant in place of fire.

trait.name: Destructive Maw
entries: Aisling deals an extra {@dice 1d10} damage with their bite attack (included in the attack). The extra damage is of of the type associated with their Draconic Essence trait.

trait.name: Enhanced Attacks
entries: Aisling has a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with their bite and claw attacks (included in the attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aisling makes three attacks: one with their bite and two with their claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage and {@h}5 ({@dice 1d10}) fire or radiant damage (your choice).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Aisling exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is of the type associated with Aisling's Draconic Essence trait.

reaction.name: Protect Rider
entries: When an attack would target a creature mounted on Aisling, Aisling can use a reaction to force the attack to target them instead.

monster.name: Terrorwing (Young)
languages: knows the languages Agrax does but does not speak

trait.name: Draconic Essence (Acid)
entries: Terrorwing is immune to acid damage. Their Breath Weapon uses acid damage.

trait.name: Construct Design
entries: Terrorwing's creature type is contruct rather than dragon. They are immune to disease, poison, psychic and the {@condition poisoned} condition. They also do not need to eat, drink, breathe or sleep and magic cannot put it to sleep.

trait.name: Iron Will
entries: Terrorwing is immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

trait.name: Enhanced Defence
entries: Terrorwing has a +1 bonus to their Armor Class and saving throws (included).

trait.name: Relentless Endurance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If damage would reduce the terrorwing to 0 hit points, they instead drop to 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Terrorwing makes three attacks: one with their bite and two with their claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Terrorwing exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage is of the type associated with Terrorwing's Draconic Essence trait.

reaction.name: Protect Rider
entries: When an attack would target a creature mounted on Terrorwing, Terrorwing can use a reaction to force the attack to target them instead.

vehicle.name: Holo Holo

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 2 crew)
25 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 35 ft. while sailing with the wind.

action: On its turn, the catamaran can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than two crew. It can't take these actions if it has no crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

vehicle.name: Lesboat

control.name: Helm
entries: Move up to the speed of one of its movement components, with one 90-degree turn. If the helm is destroyed, the ship can't turn.
20 ft. (requires at least 2 crew)
25 ft.; 15 ft. while sailing into the wind; 35 ft. while sailing with the wind.

action: On its turn, the small ship can take 2 actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only 1 action if it has fewer than four crew. It can't take these actions if it has fewer than two crew.

items.name: Move.
items.entry: The ship can use its helm to move with its oars or sails.

tools: Choose 1 from; {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|phb}, {@item Cartographer's Tools|phb}, {@item Forgery Kit|phb}, {@item Herbalism Kit|phb}, {@item Thieves' Tools|phb}, {@item Navigator's Tools|phb}, {@item Painter's Supplies|phb}

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|type=martial weapon=sand|category=basic} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial or simple weapons|items|source=phb|type=martial weapon;simple weapon=sor|category=basic}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (c) {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}
A {@item dagger|phb}, a {@item grappling hook|phb} and a notebook.

fluff.name: Lorehunter
entries: WIP

tools: Choose 1 from; {@item Alchemist's Supplies|phb}, {@item Herbalist's Kit|phb} and {@item Poisoner's Kit|phb}

default: (a) {@item quarterstaff|phb} or (b) a {@item shortbow|phb} and 20 {@item arrow|phb|arrows}
(a) a {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item druidic focus|phb}
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) or an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
Two {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, 5 candles and a witch's hood, hat or headdress.

tools: Choose 1 from; {@item Alchemist's Supplies|phb}, {@item Herbalist's Kit|phb} and {@item Poisoner's Kit|phb}

fluff.name: Witch
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Calculated Strike
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can utilize your knowledge to pinpoint weak spots and improve the damage you deal with weapons. Once per turn, when you hit with a weapon attack or unarmed strike, you can add a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Scholarly Expertise
entries: At 1st level, choose up to two skills, instruments, tools or vehicles with which you are proficient. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies. When you gain a level in this class you can replace one of these proficiencies with a different one.

entries.name: Optional Variant: Expert Topics
entries: Sometimes specialist knowledge of a particular topic is more useful than general knowledge in a skill or device. If your DM allows, you can choose a specialist topic in place of a proficiency for your Scholarly Expertise feature. When you make an ability check that utilises your specialist topic, you can add your proficiency bonus. If you already add your proficiency bonus, the bonus is doubled for this check.

Work with your DM to define the scope and depth of the topic. This could be knowledge of a particular faction, including its history, politics and laws; it could be knowledge of a particular deity or being and their followers; it could be knowledge of the anatomy and behaviors of particular kinds of creatures; it could be knowledge of a particular school of magic or any other topic you and your DM deem appropriate.

For example, you may study demons and posses expert knowledge about them. With the demon topic in your book, you may double your proficiency for checks made to identify, track or recall lore about creatures with the demon tag.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again. If your DM allows, you can choose a fighting style from the Fighter class instead.

Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to lorehunters. This replacement represents a shift of focus in your martial practice.

entries.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. They count as lorehunter spells for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for them. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the wizard spell list.

entries.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By 2nd level, you have learned to draw on arcane magic through study and practice to cast spells as a wizard does. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter lorehunter spell list|spells|class=lorehunter (j:lore)}.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Lorehunter table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter lorehunter spells|spells|class=lorehunter (j:lore)}. To cast one of your lorehunter spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of lorehunter spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the lorehunter spell list. When you do so, choose a number of lorehunter spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your lorehunter level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level lorehunter, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of lorehunter spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your lorehunter spells, since their power derives from the strength of your convictions. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a lorehunter spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item arcane focus|phb} or a book as a spellcasting focus for your lorehunter spells.

classFeature.name: Scholastic Society
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an academic society from which you gained your knowledge and skills. This society may be an order that you belong to, or that you have acquired knowledge and skills from by other means, with or without their permission. Alternatively, it could be a person or figure that has taught or inspired you to pursue your search for knowledge.
Your choice grants features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Arcane Sense
entries: At 3rd level, you hone your senses with and for the arcane. Choose one of the following options:

items.name: Spellsense
entries: As an action, you can expand a spell slot and focus your senses to search for the presence of magic. For the next 10 minutes, you can sense when a creature within 60ft of you casts a spell. You know the location the spell was cast from and the school of magic that the spell belongs to.

items.name: Arcane Mind
entries: Choose a {@filter 1st-level spell from the divination school of magic and that has a range of self |spells|level=1|school=d|range=self}. You can cast the chosen spell at will, without requiring a a spell slot. When you gain a level in this class, you can change the chosen spell for a different one.

classFeature.name: Invigorating Knowledge
entries: Starting at 4th level, learning new things or successfully applying existing knowledge grants you an inspiring feeling of satisfaction. When you succeed on an Intelligence check, or a creature you aid with the {@action Help} action succeeds on an Intelligence check, you can gain temporary hit points equal to twice your Intelligence modifier (Minimum of 1).

classFeature.name: Careful Stride
entries: Starting at 6th level, on your turn you can choose to move carefully to avoid certain dangers. Until the start of your next turn, your speed is halved and you cannot take the Dash action, but you make no noise as a result of moving and you have advantage on saving throws against traps, spells and effects that are triggered by your weight or movement. In addition, attacks against you that are triggered by your weight or movement, such as opportunity attacks or readied attacks, have disadvantage. You cannot use this feature if you have already moved in this turn.

classFeature.name: Additional Expertise
entries: At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (or specialist topics) to gain the benefit of your Scholary Expertise.

classFeature.name: Society Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature from your Society.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Society Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature from your Society.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Society Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature from your Society.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: WIP

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Through rituals and charms, you cast witch spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the {@filter witch spell list|spells|class=witch}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the witch spell list. You learn additional witch cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the witch table. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one cantrip you learned from this Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the witch spell list.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The witch table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your witch spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of witch spells that are available for you to cast. To do so, choose a number of witch spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + your witch level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you're a 3rd-level witch, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination, chosen from your spellbook. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell magic missile}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of witch spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your witch spells; your understanding of the theory behind magic allows you to wield these spells with superior skill. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a witch spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a witch spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared. You can also cast spells as rituals using your Witchcraft Rituals feature.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item druidic focus|phb}, a broom, a skull or a mummified hand as a spellcasting focus for your witch spells.

classFeature.name: Witchcraft Rituals
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can cast a witch spell that lacks the ritual tag as a ritual. The spell must be one you have prepared that is 3rd-level or lower.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Witch Coven
entries: At 2nd level, you choose a witch coven from which you learned your magic. You may have belonged to this coven, or you may have acquired the coven's secrets through other means. Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 2nd level and again at 6th, 14th and 20th level.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: Starting at 3rd level,...WIP

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain feature from your witch coven.

classFeature.name: Enchanted Transport
entries: Starting at 10th level, you can use a bonus action to enchant a non-magical object that is no more than 10 feet in any dimension, such as a bed, a broom, a cauldron or a rug. The object becomes magical and begins to hover. Once on each of your turns for the next hour, you can command the object to fly up to 50 feet in any direction (no action required). A creature can grasp or mount the object to fly with it.

At the end of the duration, the magic effect ends and the object becomes non-magical again, falling to the ground if the only thing holding it aloft is this effect. The effect also ends early if the object is ever more than 1 mile from you, if it is ever carrying more than 1000 pounds or if the dispel magic spell is cast on it.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain feature from your witch coven.

classFeature.name: WIP
entries: Starting at 18th level,...WIP

classFeature.name: Coven Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain feature from your witch coven.

subclassFeatures.name: Antiquarian
entries: Antiques are some of the best ways to learn about the past. These objects can tell you much about the economics, culture and technology of particular regions and time periods. Such object can also gradualy gather faint magical energies throughout their long years, undetectable to most, but not all.

Antiquarian societies specialize in cataloguing and preserving items of historical or cultural importance. While this often involves carefully cleaning and storing such items, it can also mean continuing to use them, honoring their purpose while still preserving their form and history. Antiquarian lorehunters can weave the residual magic of these objects into offensive and defensive wards, protecting the item itself as well as those using them.

entries.name: Antiquarian Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Antiquarian Spells table. These spells count as lorehunter spells for you, but they don't count against the number of lorehunter spells you prepare.

entries.name: Useful Antiques
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can spend 10 mins touching an item that can be worn or that can be held in one hand. You concentrate residual magical energies surrounding it, making it both more effective and more durable. The item becomes magical if it wasn't already and you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your lorehunter spells. In addition, the item gains additional effects based on it type, as described below.

items: {@b {@i A document, figurine or similar ceremonial item (WIP).}} The item grants a +1 bonus to ability checks in which it is relevent, such as recalling associated lore or convincing someone of its legitimacy. In addition, when a creature holding the item makes an ability check that would benefit from this bonus, it can also use your Intelligence modifier in place of the normal ability modifer used for the check.

{@b {@i A set of armor or a shield.}} The armor or shield grants a +1 bonus to the wearer's Armor Class, unless it already provides the same bonus or higher. In addition, if the armour would normally allow the wearer to add its Dexterity modifer to its Armor Class, it can instead add your Intelligence modifer.

{@b {@i A set of tools or artisan tools.}} The tools grant a +1 bonus to ability checks made with them, unless they already provides the same bonus or higher. In addition, when a creature uses these tools to make an ability check, it can use your Intelligence modifier in place of the normal ability modifier for the check.

{@b {@i A spellcasting focus (WIP).}} The focus grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls made using it, unless it already provides the same bonus or higher. In addition, when a creature makes a spell attack using this focus, it can use your Intelligence modifier in place of its normal ability modifier.

{@b {@i A weapon (WIP).}} The weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using it, unless it already provides the same bonus or higher. In addition, when attacking with the weapon a creature can use your Intelligence modifer in place of its Strength or Dexterity modifer for the attack and damage rolls

entries: Sometimes an item may have enough historical, cultural or political significance to be considered an antique. The DM decides if an item is an antique. Items that are; several centuries old, were used by famous historical figures, or were used in legendary events can usually be considered antiques. The +1 bonuses described above increase to +2 if the item is an antique.

You can have up to two items enhanced in this way at any one time. If you attempt to use this feature on a third, the oldest effect ends. The effect is also removed if you remove it with another 10 minute ritual or if you die.

entries.name: Conservation Arcana
entries: At 3rd level, you know the {@spell mending|phb} cantrip. It counts as a lorehunter spell for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. When you cast this cantrip, you can also clear rust from metal objects and restore faded color to dyed and painted objects.
You can cast the cantrip as normal, and you can also cast it as an action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Arcane Antiques
entries: Starting at 7th level, the magic surrounding your Useful Antiques grows stronger. As a bonus action, you can expend a spell slot for one of the following effects, targeting one oof the items enhanced by your Useful Antiques feature.

items: {@b {@i Archivist's Preservation.}} A creature that is holding or wearing the targeted item gains temporary hit points equal to six times the level of the spell slot expended. A creature loses these temporary hit points if it is ever more than 5 feet from the item for more than one minute.

{@b {@i Historian's Smite.}} The next time a creature hits with an attack using the targeted weapon or focus, or with an unarmed strike using the targeted armor, the attack deals an extra {@dice d10} force damage per level of the spell slot expended.

entries.name: Useful Antiques Collection
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you use your Useful Antiques feature you can have up to four enhanced items simultaneously, instead of just two.
When you use your Arcane Antiques feature, you can target two items using the same spell slot, granting the same effect to both items.

entries.name: Resourceful Artifacts
entries: Starting at 15th level, you ignore all class, race, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

Additionally, if a magic item allows you to activate it with an action, you can instead choose to activate it with a bonus action. This feature cannot be used to change the casting time of a spell you cast using the item. You can this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Palaeontologist
entries: WIP

entries.name: Palaeontologist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Palaeontologist Spells table. These spells count as lorehunter spells for you, but they don't count against the number of lorehunter spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Palaeontologist Spells
rows: {@spell speak with animals|phb}, {@spell find familiar|phb} (appears as undead)
{@spell conjure animals|phb} (appear as undead rather than fey), {@spell speak with dead|phb}

entries.name: Adept Archaeologist
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use a bone from a long dead beast or a trowel as a spellcasting focus for your lorehunter spells. In addition, you have advantage on any ability checks you make to disarm traps or to carefully extract items from loose earth without damaging them.

entries.name: Ancient Bones
entries: At 3rd level, you can use an action to summon the spirit of a long dead beast to an unoccupied space you can see within 30ft of you.

When you summon the beast, you choose its size and its stat block; Undead Bulker (WIP), Undead Prowler (WIP) or Undead Soarer (WIP) which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. You also determine the appearance of the beast, choosing a form appropriate for its stat block. You can choose to summon an aquatic creature instead of one from the land. In which case, its walking speed becomes 5 feet and it gains a swim speed equal to its previous walking speed.

Alternatively, you can choose a beast with a CR of 1 or lower that has the dinosaur tag (your DM might allow other similar creatures). The creature appears as undead rather than beast, is immune to poison and necrotic damage and is also immune to the poisoned and charmed conditions. The creature shares your proficiency bonus and understands any languages you know but does not speak. The maximum CR of the creature you summon increases by 1 when you reach 5th level (CR 2), 11th level (CR 3) and 17th level (CR 4) in this class.

The creature shares your initiative count in combat and will obey any verbal commands you give it (no action required by you). If you issue no commands on a turn it will defend itself and follow you but takes other actions. The creature remains for 1 hour after which it crumbles to dust, unless you expend another use of this feature, or a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, to extend it by another hour. The creature crumbles early if it is reduced to 0 hit points, or if you use this feature again.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. While you have no uses available, you can spend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher to use this feature again.

entries.name: Fossilised Arcana
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell magic stone|phb} cantrip. It counts as a lorehunter spell for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

When you cast the spell, you can target up to five tiny bones, teeth or fossils rather than pebbles. When an attack hits with one of these items, you can choose to have it deal necrotic or piercing damage (your choice), rather than bludgeoning. In addition, when an attack with it hits or misses, an item flys to your hand or feet before the spell ends on it.

entries.name: Unearthing Arcana
entries: {@i Optional feature which replaces Fossilised Arcana}
At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell mold earth|phb} cantrip. It counts as a lorehunter spell for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

When you cast the spell, you can do one of the normal effects, or you can detect the presence of fossils or deceased animal matter, such as bones, teeth or shells, within a 10-foot cube of earth or stone (you must be able to see the entirety of at least one side of the cube). You know the location and approximate size of such items within the area, but do not learn the type or identity of the creature it originated from.

entries.name: Calcified Bones
entries: Starting at 7th level, a creature you summon with your Ancient Bones (or Ancient King) feature has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage as its bones become as hard as stone.
In addition, the creature's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entries.name: Fossilised Flesh
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can use an action to begin turning the flesh and bone of a creature you can see within 30 feet into stone. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your lorehunter spell save DC or become fossilised for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the effects on a success. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has advantage on this saving throw.

A fossilised creature's speed is halved, it has a -2 penalty to its Armor Class and dexterity saving throws. On its turn, it can take one action or one bonus action, not both. The creature cannot take the Dash or Dodge action. A creature summoned by your Ancient Bones feature deals an additional 1d8 damage with attacks against the fossiled creature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: WIP
entries: WIP

entries.name: Ancient King
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can expend two uses of your Ancient Bones feature to summon a tyrannosaurus rex, otherwise following the same rules and benefits of that feature. You cannot use spell slots to summon the tyrannosaurus rex or extend its duration.

The tyrannosaurus obeys your commands as long as you maintain concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). You can dismiss the tyrannosaurus at any point on your turn (no action required). If you lose concentration before dismissing it, you also lose control of the tyrannosaurus and can no longer command or dismiss it. Using your Ancient Bones feature again after you lose control does not dismiss the tyrannosaurus. It spends its remaining turns pursuing and attacking any nearby creatures.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

spell.name: Darklight

components.m: a metal or glass rod worth at least 1sp

entries: You touch the rod used in the spell's casting and it begins to emit a faint, dark-purple glow, casting dim light out to a range of 60ft for the spell's duration. Choose up to six creatures (this can include yourself) when you cast the spell to see the light, the light is invisible to all other creatures.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of a higher level, the range of the light increases to 120ft with a 3rd-level slot or higher, and to 300ft with a 5th-level slot or higher.

spell.name: Analyse Weakness
entries: You observe one creature you can see within range and determine methods to circumvent a particular resistance of theirs. Choose a damage type; acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, piercing, poison, psychic, radiant, slashing, or thunder.
For the spell's duration, you and any creatures you choose can ignore the target's resistance, if any, to the chosen damage type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Explosive Excavation

components.m: A pinch of black power or clay

entries: You create a powerful concusive explosion in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 4d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area. If the object is made primarily of inorganic or vegetable matter, such as stone, wood or metal, it takes double damage from this spell. Loose objects and earth are blasted up to 10 feet away from the center of the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Speak with Documents

components.m: A bookmark or a magnifying class worth at least 10gp

entries: You awaken some imitation of sentience within a collection of books, scrolls or similar documents that fit within a 5-foot cube, allowing it to answer questions you pose to them. The spell fails if the documents are protected from divination or were the target of this spell within the last 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the documents up to five questions. The documents possess knowledge of their contents, understands the languages written within in and basic information about their creation and history. The documents can quickly summarise information or speculate based upon its knowledge. A document may know basic information about who created it and when, but doesn't know anything about other documents it may have been copied from. For example, a printed book may know when it was printed and the company that printed it, but it might not know anything about the author who created the original text.

spell.name: Perfect Recall
entries: You magically preserve the information your senses receive for recreation at a later date. You perfectly record the sights, sounds and smells you sense within a 30-foot radius sphere centered on yourself for the duration of the spell. The spell cannot record things which you do not witness with your senses at the time, such as creatures and objects that are invisible or behind cover.

At any point within the next year, you can cast this spell again to project an illusionary version of the scene in an area around you. Creatures inside the area can witness the scene as you did, though they cannot witness anything you didn't, regardless of their own senses.

spell.name: Stagger/Sunder
entries: You find and highlight weaknesses in the defences of a creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition staggered|J:general} or {@condition sundered|J:general} (your choice) for the spell's duration. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, removing the condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 3rd-level or higher, you can target an additional creature for every level above 2nd-level.

spell.name: Enhance Concoction

components.m: 5gp worth of herbs, tinctures and extracts which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a potion or poison and modify it in one of the ways listed below. A potion or poison can only benefit from this spell once.

items: If the potion or poison allows a target to make a saving throw, you can change the DC of this saving throw to your spell save DC.
The first time the potion or poison deals damage or healing, you can increase this damage or healing by {@dice 2d6}.
If the potion or poison deals poison damage to a target, you can make it ignore resistance to poison damage.
If the potion or poison normally deals poison damage, you can change the damage type to one of the following; acid, cold, fire, lightning or necrotic.
If the potion or poison subjects a target to an effect with a duration of 1 minute or more, you can double this duration.
If the potion or poison imposes the {@condition charmed} condition on a target, you change this to impose the {@condition frightened} condition instead, or vice versa.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 3rd-level or higher, you can target one additional potion or poison for each spell slot above 2nd. You can choose a different effect for each item.

spell.name: Mind Step
entries: You choose a creature you can see within range and force that creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, you briefly enter the creature's mind and travel through its senses. Choose an unoccupied space the creature can see within 10 feet of it, you instantly teleport into that space. In addition, the creature is {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.
